channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Wales' MPs could be cut by eight as major changes published
item.description: The Welsh secretary is among the MPs seeing their seats redrawn in the proposals.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No firebreak lockdown planned
item.description: The Welsh government says it is continuing to closely monitor the public health situation.

item.title: National Insurance rise will hit jobs and stifle growth, FSB warns
item.description: Boris Johnson says the 1.25 percentage point rise to National Insurance would raise £12bn a year.

item.title: Cladding: Cardiff homeowner's tears as safety costs spiral
item.description: As well as increased charges and insurance costs, many owners also face expensive repair work.

item.title: Betws-y-Coed: Biker killed in crash with another motorbike
item.description: A second man is in hospital with serious injuries following the crash near Betws-y-Coed.

item.title: Anglesey: Relatives' anger over church conversion plans
item.description: Plans have been approved to turn it into a house but relatives still visit family graves there.

item.title: Sir Harry Secombe: Treasure trove shared on centenary
item.description: The Goon Show, Oliver and Songs of Praise star Sir Harry Secombe's archive is shared.

item.title: Wales v Estonia: Robert Page welcomes return of unlimited crowds for World Cup qualifier in Cardiff
item.description: Robert Page welcomes return of unlimited crowds as Wales aim to climb to second place in their World Cup qualifying group by beating Estonia in Cardiff.

item.title: Wales to get extra cash from new NHS and social care tax
item.description: Up to £700m a year will be given to Wales by 2025, the UK government says.

item.title: Carmarthen: Doctor jailed after paedophile hunter sting
item.description: Jamil Rehman was caught by paedophile hunters after travelling to meet a 15-year-old girl.

item.title: Wales basks in September sun - but will it last?
item.description: It may officially be autumn - but Wales will bask in sunshine as temperatures soar on Tuesday.

item.title: Pet dementia: 85% of cases in dogs and cats undiagnosed, say vets
item.description: Poppy was a lively Staffie-cross, but vets say she is among the one in four dogs to get dementia.

item.title: Rare angelshark filmed in Welsh waters 'for first time'
item.description: Angelsharks are an endangered species but the young spotting proves they are breeding in the UK

item.title: Dementia in dogs 'heartbreaking', says Wrexham woman
item.description: Staffie cross Poppy is one of the 10% of dogs with dementia who get a diagnosis.

item.title: Iron Age hillfort at risk from the sea in Gwynedd
item.description: Archaeologists return to a 2,000-year-old Welsh hillfort which is being reclaimed by the Irish Sea.

item.title: Recycling: How do you transform old PPE into something new?
item.description: Turning millions of disposable masks and medical waste into new items is one firm's new mission.

item.title: Wheelchair Moto Cross: Teen's push for Paralympic recognition
item.description: Lily Rice is already a world champion - and now wants to see her sport given a Paralympic stage

item.title: Firefighters tackle large Blaenavon recycling plant blaze
item.description: Residents living nearby have been advised to keep windows and doors closed due to smoke.

item.title: Owain Doull: Welshman set to leave Ineos Grenadiers
item.description: Owain Doull is set to leave Ineos Grenadiers at the end of the season and join a rival Grand Tour team.

item.title: Gareth Bale: Wales aiming for top spot in World Cup qualifying, says captain
item.description: Gareth Bale says Wales believe they can topple the world's highest-ranked team Belgium and qualify for their first World Cup since 1958.

item.title: Wales: FAW confirms fans can travel to October away qualifiers
item.description: The Football Association of Wales has confirmed Wales fans will be allowed to travel to October's World Cup Qualifiers in Czech Republic and Estonia.

item.title: County Championship: Glamorgan hold up Durham victory charge
item.description: Durham's victory charge against Glamorgan is held up as 96 from Dan Douthwaite helps take the match into a fourth day.

item.title: Bulgaria U21 0-4 Wales U21: Jack Vale scores perfect hat-trick in thumping win
item.description: Jack Vale scores a perfect hat-trick as Wales Under-21s cruise to a first win of their Uefa U21 Euro 2023 qualifying campaign against Bulgaria.

item.title: Ad-drefnu etholaethau: Diddymu Arfon a dwy sedd y gogledd
item.description: Cyhoeddi cynigion ar ad-drefnu etholaethau seneddol Cymru, gydag wyth yn llai o seddi yn San Steffan.

item.title: 'Anfoesol' ac 'annoeth' troi eglwys ger mynwent ym Môn yn dŷ
item.description: "Faswn i ddim yn licio meddwl y bydd rhywun yn byw yma ac o bosib yn cynnal partïon ganol nos."

item.title: 'Dim cynlluniau' am gyfnod clo byr i Gymru yn yr hydref
item.description: Ond undeb addysg yn cydnabod y byddai'n "un mesur posib" os ydy sefyllfa Covid yn cyfiawnhau hynny.

item.title: 7 cwestiwn i Dafydd Meredydd
item.description: Dyma ddod i adnabod Dafydd Meredydd, Pennaeth Gwasanaethau Cymraeg newydd BBC Cymru, ychydig yn well.

item.title: Rhagbrofol Euro dan-21 2023: Bwlgaria 0-4 Cymru
item.description: Hwb i obeithion tîm dan-21 Cymru i gyrraedd Euro 2023 gyda buddugoliaeth swmpus oddi cartref.
